授業目的: This course aims to provide fundamental knowledge and skills for seeking international career including the United Nations through leaning global competencies, interview skills, CV writing, and personal development plan.
到達目標:
1) Students will understand UN job descriptions and be able to prepare effective Curriculum Vitae and Cover letters for future job seeking.　
2) Students will be able to communicate persuasively with clarity and present their value, knowledge and experience in meetings, interviews and application documents.　
3) Students will understand UN and global competencies and be ready for diversified international workplaces.
4) Students will assess their competencies based on UN Competency Framework and formulate personal competency development plans for their continued career development after graduation.
授業方法: This class will be held by face to face on campus.

第1回:
Introduction, UN competencies, and Job Description (Nishino).
Objectives: Students will understand UN core values, UN competencies, basic composition and key points of UN Job Descriptions.

[Pre-assignment] Review UN Careers Home page and familiarize terminologies.
https://careers.un.org/lbw/Home.aspx
第2回:
Developing personal competency development plan (Kukita)
Objectives: Students will review their career images from lifelong vision, and design much clearer career paths, based on their personal mission, goals and strategies, and job competency requirements, career development options, and time frame.
[Pre-assignment] Students prepare their own personal mission, strategy and goals, and self-assess their own competencies based on UN Competency Framework.
第3回:
Presentation of zero draft personal plan (Kukita)
Objectives: Students present their career and competency development plans based on their own missions, goals, strategies, career paths and competency assessment, which will guide their personal and professional development in life.
[Pre-assignment] Each student prepares a personal draft life, career, competency development plan, with mission, goals, strategy, career path options and time frame
第4回:
Understanding Job Description (Nishino).
Objectives: Students will fully understand and be able to explain required skills and competencies for the position selected by him/herself.
[Pre-assignment] Students will select one UN vacancy, obtain job description and analyse required skills and competencies.
第5回:
Preparation of Curriculum Vitae (Nishino)
Objectives: Students will prepare and improve their Curriculum Vitae through peer review and mutual interview against JD.
[Pre-assignment] Students will prepare his/her CV to apply for the selected vacancy.
第6回:
Tailoring your cover letter preparation (Nishino)
Objectives: Students will be able to prepare effective cover letter for international career through peer review and mutual examination.

[Pre-assignment] Students will prepare a cover letter for application.
[Final Assignment] Students will prepare and submit final CV and cover letter.
第7回:
Presentation for jobs (Murata)
Objectives: Students to learn by doing their own simulation and presentation of a given subject (relevant the on- going research/intern placement) by resource person. The selection of the subject will be discussed in advance. “First 5 minutes” would be the key to attract the audience. The participants are required to comment on each presentation on the spot to further improve skills. The participants’ presentation should be filmed and reviewed in the class.
[Pre-assignment] Read “Craft the Beginning”, HBR Guide to Persuasive Presentations by Nancy Duarte, 2012 ISBN:978-1-4221-8710-4
第8回:
Reflection of previous sessions (Murata)
Objectives: Reflection of the soft spots and the strengths will be highlighted for the participants. Resource person and the participants are to review the “Common Ground” to refine each presentation with specific interventions. The presentation should be filmed again.
[Pre-assignment] Read  “Common Ground”, HBR Guide to Persuasive Presentations by Nancy Duarte, 2012 ISBN:978-1-4221-8710-4
第9回:
Impromptu speech (Murata)
Objectives: The participants will be given an opportunity for impromptu speech (selection of theme is at random). Ability to be tested from the various angles by resource person based upon the experience of previous sessions. The speech/presentation should be prepared within 5minutes followed by 5minutes presentations. The presentations will be filmed.

[Pre-assignment] Read the following references before the class:
http://lyndagratton.com/uploads/BSR%20-%20LG%20investigates%20the%20FOW.pdf
第10回:
Wrap up session (Murata)
Objectives: Resource person will wrap up the points of the last 3 sessions together with the participants in taking a close look at the videoed presentations.

[Pre-assignment] Read “Anticipate Resistance”, HBR Guide to Persuasive Presentations by Nancy Duarte, 2012 ISBN:978-1-4221-8710-4
[Assignment] Students are required to submit “one page” wrap up paper within 48 hours.
第11回:
Understanding diversity management practices in international workplaces (Konishi)
Objectives: This class introduces the historical developments and classic model of diversity, and new developments in diversity theory. Moreover, by looking into several case studies of global private companies, students can learn how the diversity model can be applied into the real workplaces.
References and reading materials are available via LUNA.

[Pre-assignment] Read the following references before the class:
http://lyndagratton.com/uploads/BSR%20-%20LG%20investigates%20the%20FOW.pdf
第12回:
Performance Management System and Competencies in the International Organizations
(Konishi)
Objectives: Students can learn performance management system of international organizations and how to develop competencies in one’s career, by looking into concrete case study. Students are expected to actively participate in group and class discussions.
Case study reading material is available via LUNA. Students are expected to read thoroughly and prepare for a class discussion.
第13回:
Understanding future life and work, and identifying your transferable skills (Konishi)
By taking this class, students will be able to understand the importance of lifelong learning, and identify one’s transferable skills to enhance employability in order to pursue global career. Video viewing and conducting exercise in the class.
Reading materials are available via LUNA.
第14回:
Review and way forward (Nishino)
Review all sessions and reflect necessary points and actions to pursue global career.
